title: IoT Based Smart Irrigation System for Precision Farming. Team Krishi-Shakti

tasks.task: Construct and implement a smart irrigation system for agriculture.
subtasks: Define the problem of water scarcity in agriculture.
Research traditional irrigation methods and their inefficiencies.
Design a smart irrigation system using IoT technologies.
Develop a robotic car equipped with sensors for soil moisture, temperature, nutrient levels, and rainfall detection.
Integrate IR sensors, thermal cameras, and other sensors for environmental monitoring.
Utilize ESP826 to control the robotic car based on sensor data.
Transmit data to an IoT platform (e.g., Blink) for analysis.
Implement AI algorithms (AIML) for precise data analysis.
Provide a user-friendly interface for farmers to visualize data like temperature, humidity, nutritional levels, etc.
Automatically control irrigation through a single click by the farmer.
Incorporate GPRS sensor for car location tracking.

tasks.task: Create a video demonstration of the smart irrigation system.
subtasks: Film a video showcasing the robotic car in action.
Present the irrigation system's capabilities and effectiveness.
Highlight user interaction through the interface and automatic irrigation functions.
Demonstrate accuracy in soil analysis and weather condition integration.
